Cache defaults

Type:

Source:
cache/Cache.js

Methods

createResource(parentHref, query, data, instanceCtor, callback)

Creates a new resource on the server as a child of the specified parentHref location (must be a collection resource endpoint).

Parameters:
Name Type Description
parentHref String

The URI of the parent collection under which the new resource will be created as a child. This must always be the first argument.
query Object

[optional=null] Key/value pairs to use as query parameters to parentHref.
data Object

The resource (name/value pairs) to send to the server.
instanceCtor function

[optional=InstanceResource] The Constructor function to invoke for any Instance Resource returned by the server. If the resource returned by the server is a single resource, this function is used to construct the resource. If the resource returned by the server is a collection, instanceCtor is used to construct each resource in the collection's items field.
callback function

The callback function to invoke with the constructed Resource. callback's first argument is an Error object if an error occured, the second is the constructed resource. callback must always be the last argument.
Version:
  • 0.1
Source:
ds/DataStore.js
Returns:

no return value; the acquired resource is instead provided to callback.

Type
void

getAuthenticator(options)

A factory function that inspects any options and returns an appropriate RequestAuthenticator to use to authenticate requests submitted to the API server.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
options object
Properties
Name Type Description
requestAuthenticator Sauthc1RequestAuthenticator | BasicRequestAuthenticator
authenticationScheme string

name of auth method that will instantiated
Source:
authc/index.js
Returns:
Type
*

getResource(href, query, instanceCtor, callback)

Queries the server for a resource by href, providing the result to callback.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
href String

The URI of the resource to acquire. This must always be the first argument.
query Object

[optional=undefined] Key/value pairs to use as query parameters to href.
instanceCtor function

[optional=InstanceResource] The Constructor function to invoke for any Instance Resource returned by the server. If the resource returned by the server is a single resource, this function is used to construct the resource. If the resource returned by the server is a collection, instanceCtor is used to construct each resource in the collection's items field.
callback function

The callback function to invoke with the constructed Resource. callback's first argument is an Error object if an error occured, the second is the constructed resource. callback must always be the last argument.
Version:
  • 0.1
Source:
ds/DataStore.js
Returns:

no return value; the acquired resource is instead provided to callback.

Type
void

instantiate(InstanceConstructor, data, query, dataStore)

A factory function that creates and returns a new Resource instance. The server is not contacted in any way - this function merely instantiates the object in memory and returns it. Callers are responsible for persisting the returned instance's state to the server if desired.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
InstanceConstructor

the specific Resource constructor to call when creating the instance.
data

the data acquired from the server
query

any query that was provided to the server when acquiring the data
dataStore

the dataStore used by the resource to communicate with the server. required for all resources.
Source:
resource/ResourceFactory.js
Returns:

a new Resource memory instance

isAssignableFrom(ctor, toTest)

Returns true if the first constructor function is equal to, or a super of, the second constructor function.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
ctor

the constructor function that might be equal to or a super of 'toTest'.
toTest

the constructor function to test
Source:
utils.js

resolveArgs()

Takes a list of arguments and maps them to a list of names in an alternating either a left-to-right, or right-to-left direction.

Source:
utils.js

valueOf(obj, defaultVal)

Ensures 'undefined' is never encountered on value assignment. Works as follows:

  1. Return obj if not null or undefined.
  2. Then return defaultVal if not null or undefined.
  3. Return null as last resort.

    Example usage:

function(someVal) {
  var possiblyNullButNeverUndefined = util.valueOf(someVal.foo);
}
or: 
function(someVal) {
  var fooOrDefaultValueIfFooDoesNotExist = util.valueOf(someVal.foo, 'DefaultVavlue');
}
Parameters:
Name Type Argument Description
obj
defaultVal <optional>
Source:
utils.js
Returns:
Type
*

Type Definitions

AccessTokenResponse

Type:
  • Object
Properties:
Name Type Description
access_token String

The JWT-encoded OAuth2 access token, created by the Stormpath REST API.
refresh_token String

The JWT-encoded OAuth2 refresh token, created by the Stormpath REST API.
token_type String

The OAuth2 token type, will always be 'Bearer'.
expires_in Number

The number of seconds that this token is valid for.
stormpath_access_token_href String

The HREF of the Stormpath resource that represents this token. To revoke the token, delete this resource.
Source:
jwt/jwt-authentication-result.js

}

CollectionQueryOptions

This object allows you to add query parameters when requesting collections from the Stormpath REST API. The query parameters allow you to sort, search, and limit the results that are returned. For more information, please see: REST API Reference: Collection Resources.

Type:
  • Object
Properties:
Name Type Argument Description
expand String <optional>

Comma-separated list of linked resources to expand on the returned resources. Not all links are available for expansion. For more information, please see: REST API Reference: Links.

Example: 'customData, directory'
limit Number <optional>

The maximum number of collection items to return for a single request. Minimum value is 1. Maximum value is 100. Default is 25.
offset Number <optional>

The zero-based starting index in the entire collection of the first item to return. Default is 0.
orderBy String <optional>

URL-encoded comma-separated list of ordering statements. Each ordering statement identifies a sortable attribute, and whether you would like the sorting to be ascending or descending.

Example: 'email,username asc'
q String <optional>

Stormpath will perform a case-insensitive matching query on all viewable attributes in all the resources in the Collection. Note that “viewable” means that the attribute can be viewed by the current caller. For full documentation of filter searching in the Stormpah API, please see: REST API Reference: Filter Search.
[attribute] String <optional>

Find objects by a specific attribute match, such as an email address. Not all attributes are available for matching on all resource types. Please refer to the specific resource type in this documentation, or see REST API Reference: Attribute Search.
Source:
ds/DataStore.js
Examples
// Expand custom data and directory when getting all accounts.
client.getAccounts({ expand: 'customData, directory' });
// Get all accounts, sorting by email, then username, ascending.
application.getAccounts({ orderBy: 'email,username asc' }, callbackFn);
// Find any account that has a searchable attribute containing the text “Joe”:
application.getAccounts({ q: 'Joe' }, callbackFn);
// Find all accounts with this email address.
application.getAccounts({ email: 'foo@bar.com'}, callbackFn);

GetResourceOptions

This object allows you to pass query options when making GET requests for individual resources from the Stormpath API.

Type:
  • Object
Properties:
Name Type Argument Description
expand String <optional>

A comma-separated list of linked resources that should be expanded during the GET request.
Source:
ds/DataStore.js
Example
account.getDirectory({ expand: 'groups, customData' }, callbackFn);

IdSiteAuthenticationResult

Type:
  • Object
Properties:
Name Type Description
account Object

The account that was authenticated on ID Site.
state String

Custom state that was passed to ID Site, via the original request from Application.createIdSiteUrl().
isNew String

Indicates that this account is a new account, and the registration was completed on ID Site.
status String

Indicates the action that the user completed on ID Site, which will be one of the following:

  • AUTHENTICATED - The user already had an account and they successfully authenticated ("logged in").
  • REGISTERED - The user created a new account on ID Site.
  • LOGOUT - The user has logged out.
Source:
resource/Application.js
